overview: A semantic, accessible, and responsive healthcare homepage featuring navigation, hero content, informational sections, CTAs, and a footer. Includes accessibility hooks, ARIA roles, and test IDs for automation coverage.
key_components: Navbar with brand and navigation links
Hero section with heading, description, and SVG illustration
Introduction section with three feature cards
CTA section with service and contact links
Footer with quick links and contact info
interactions: Clicking navigation links routes to respective pages
Theme toggle switches dark/light mode and updates aria-pressed
Back-to-top button scrolls to top when visible
CTA buttons navigate to services or contact pages
data_flow: Static HTML content rendered from index.html
Theme state toggled via main.js and reflected in DOM attributes
Toast container receives dynamic messages from scripts
Navigation and CTA links trigger client-side or full-page navigation
accessibility: Skip link enables keyboard users to jump to main content
ARIA roles for navigation, contentinfo, and status regions
aria-labels and aria-pressed states for interactive elements
Proper heading hierarchy and semantic structure
analytics: Potential click tracking on CTA buttons and theme toggle
Scroll or visibility tracking for back-to-top button
Toast event logging for user notifications
test_ideas: Ensure theme-toggle toggles aria-pressed and visual theme
Validate navigation links route correctly and highlight active page
Check CTA buttons navigate to correct URLs
Confirm back-to-top button appears after scroll and scrolls to top
Validate all sections render with correct headings and content
Run accessibility audit for ARIA roles and keyboard navigation
Verify toast container announces messages via aria-live
Ensure responsive layout and no visual regressions across viewports
